posts.content:
Well that's what it was called in the States.

1963 EZ camper.

11mths MOT/Tax

Used as a daily.

Rebuilt 1600 sp motor [done in U.S. heads, cylinders, push rod tubes all looked new].

No jumping out of gear.

Really straight, check out door gaps and alignment with body contours

One respray over Pearl White original.

Perfect flat floor inside.

Comes with cooker, fridge, sink and a selection of cushions ready for interior.

Comes with spare set of windows and window surrounds + more.

Everything works including original hazards.

Rear tyres nearly new

Loads of pic's can be found here: http://s6.photobucket.com/albums/y213/b ... =slideshow

Purchased last year from a Surfing Preacher who wanted a bus he could use on the beach, I'll include his god number plates in sale.

Bus had new inner, stiffener, outer sill on cargo door side as well as the short sill. The long sill had the end removed and a new section welded in [trying to keep as much original as poss], a bit of U.S. bondo was removed from the nearside rear corner revealing some shallow dent's, re-skimmed here.
Brakes totally gone through, everything adjusted/greased up and straight through MOT

Price: Â£9,500 [no offers at this stage]

Location: Chatham Kent

frikkin ekk bri, your getting close to the realms of being called a flipper
hope all is good in your camp and this is just a lifestyle change. good luck with the sale

kev mc wrote:
lifestyle change.

Guess I should bump this up now, just having so much fun in it

Kid's are home from school/uni so out everyday, might go out in it now, sun's shining .

Beachbugging Sunday if anyone wants a nosey
this bus ticks my boxes,,,,mmmmmmmmmm
Thanks mate, ticked all mine as well
Growing on me

lee c wrote:
Growing on me


Cheers mate

It's just a straight honest bus that's being used daily [cheaper on fuel than my 3.0l jeep ], priced at what most of the dealers are pricing their projects at requiring work to get to this stage. Nothings hidden behind panels/flooring, for what I'm asking you're not going to get a mint shiny camper so here's the chance to create your own and have some fun while doing it.

I Think you can buy all the roof and interior cards pre cut from 4mm ply on ebay that simply screw on, r'n'r bed from the likes of Bluebird and you've got a camper "simples"

Yep it looks like a nice project . My wife even likes it now
The idea of planning n building a nice interior and choosing and spraying a nice colour on is a really exciting prospect

You have a pm

Hi Brian, good to see you tonight, just finished with part one of that admin task.

Look forward to you waking me at 7am on Saturday

Thought I would post a pic of another 63 bus, with a registration number 2 before yours, prefer your 63 for the 63 bus.

Nicola was saying when you left how good you bus looks, and just how solid it is. You know her...... critical.... which I guess is why she married me, I am purrrfect.
purrrfect

Hi Brian,

Did you get our PM?

Can send more pics and history of our bay if you like?

Away for the weekend with our local VW club to Gibside in 'Blue' tomorrow, so if you could let us know if you'd like the pics, and then if you're interested in a possible swap, that'd be great.

Thanks

Lee & Kat
I'll check my PM's now

To answer a few questions in one go:

As far as anyone can tell the bus is stock height and running stock suspension.

The bus is completely stock other than the wheels, weld the arches up and you've got a stock bus.

Runs and drives as good as any other stock bus I've driven [been a few ].

It was supplied by VW to the E.Z. camper company from new and would have been one of their first conversions [read somewhere that they started in 63].

Any more info required just ask

P.S. might be up for a deal on an early bay or other classic bus I can convert
You have pm
